columns.description: Unique ID of this variant in this participant (primary key)
columns.notes:
RC submitted unique variant ID
- Useful for tracking in downstream functional studies (i.e. V2F clickup database). 
- RC submitted but encourage conventional naming (genomic coordinate + participant id)

columns.description: Subject/Participant Identifier within project
columns.notes: RC submitted

columns.description: The experiment table and experiment ID(s) in which discovery was identified: experiment_table.id_in_table. Should correspond to an experiment_id in the DCC-generated experiment table.
columns.notes:
RC submitted. 
- If experiment identifier is not available due to current data model limitations, use the 'method_of_discovery' field
- If variant is identified in multiple datasets, list the assigned primary experiment_id first and fill the following rows (e.g. allele balance) with data from this experiment
- Additional information on orthogonal experiments can noted in the 'method_of_discovery' or 'notes' field

Current data model only supports SNV/INDEL variant types. 
-Other variant type in process.

columns.description: The genome build for identifying the variant position
columns.notes: Supports hg38 and future human references. If your pipeline uses a reference_assembly not currently listed, please contact the tiger team/DSA WG.

columns.description: Chromosome of the variant
Start position of the variant
Reference allele of the variant
Alternate position of the variant
ClinGen Allele ID for cross table refrence
HGNC approved gene symbol, if known
columns.notes:
HGNC symbol related to the identified variant in context of the proposed condition 
If non-coding and intergenic, use 'intergenic'. 
If non-coding and not intergenic, use 'other'.  

- Currently only single genes are allowed. Multi-gene and multi-locus variants are being discussed with the SV/CNV data model. 
- In situations where the variant overlaps two equally viable gene candidates on a single site, we suggest listing a separate discovery entry for each gene.

columns.description: Text description of transcript overlapping the variant
columns.notes:
Encourage to use MANE transcripts with version number.
- If your variant does not have MANE transcript, add most relevant transcript.

columns.description: HGVS c. description of the variant (m. for mitochondrial)
HGVS p. description of the variant
columns.notes: May use 'p.?' for non-coding variants

columns.description: Zygosity of variant
Reported allele balance (mosaic) or heteroplasmy percentage (mitochondrial)
columns.notes:
Option reporting of allele balance for mosaic or mitochondrial variants. 
- If the variant is found mosaic in a parent sample, use the free notes line 36 to report parental allele balance.

columns.description: Detection of variant in parents
columns.notes:
- For duos where the variant is only confirmed to be not maternally or paternally inherited, use nonmaternal or nonpaternal, respectively.
- If the variant is found mosaic in a parent sample, report the patient allele balance in line 20 and use the free notes line 36 to report parental allele balance. 
- in scenario where variant is present in parent A and parent B's sequencing is not available (so cannot rule out possibility parent  B also carries the variant), this should be 'unknown', since line 34 (additional_family_members_with_variant) should also contain the info that parent A has this variant

columns.description: Second variant in recessive cases
columns.notes: genetic_findings_id of a second variant in the same gene to complete a compound het.
optional description of phase if inheritance is unknown

columns.description: Indicate if the gene listed is a candidate or known disease gene. Known disease genes can be identified using OMIM or MONDO or MitoMap. Variant/phenotype in proband should be consistent with the described MOD/phenotype to be considered a known gene for condition.
columns.notes:
- Use OMIM or MONDO or MitoMap as truth source for known disease genes 
- Variant/phenotype/inheritance in the patient should be consistent with the disease entry to be considered 'Known', otherwise use 'Candidate' (e.g. phenotype expansions or novel phenotypes are considered 'Candidate' )

columns.description: Free text of condition name. Variant/phenotype/inheritance in proband should be consistent with the condition.
columns.notes: - Condition name should match the OMIM or MONDO entry listed in line 26 for known disease genes.

columns.description: MONDO/OMIM number for condition used for variant interpretation.
columns.notes: Only list a MONDO or OMIM ID if the patient's phenotype and inheritance is consistent with the established disease mechanism and gene-phenotype association.

columns.description: Description of the expected inheritance of condition used for variant interpretation
columns.notes:
Inheritance description should match the OMIM or MONDO entry listed in line 26. 
- If multiple inheritance types listed in OMIM/MONDO, select that which is suspected for this proband
- In cases where multiple inheritance patterns are being considered, it is possible to select multiple here

columns.description: Clinical significance of variant described to condition listed as determined by the RC's variant curation.
columns.notes: Field to be updated in subsequent data submissions. TBD requirement timeline. Currently optional, to consider whether required if known disease gene.

columns.description: ClinVar accession number for the variant curation submitted by your center
columns.notes: Field to be updated in subsequent data submissions. TBD requirement timeline. Currently optional, to consider whether required if already submitted.

columns.description: Public databases that this variant in this participant has been submitted by the RC.
Public database variant/case ID
Contribution of variant-linked condition to participant's phenotype.
columns.notes:
- Each discovery in a recessive pair is considered full contribution.
- If the associated gene is not known ('candidate' on line 24), use Uncertain.
- If the associated gene is known but a second hit is missing, use either Uncertain or Full (depending on your confidence of the gene in the diagnosis)

columns.description: List of specific phenotypes (HPO IDs) explained by the condition associated with this variant/gene in cases of partial contribution
columns.notes:
Field used when a genetic finding only partially explains participant phenotype and a second genetic finding is expected. For example, a syndromic case with a well-established pathogenic non-syndromic hearing loss variant. 
- For recesssive variants with partial contribution, only one of the linked variants needs to list HPO IDs explained by the linked candidate set.

columns.description: List of related participant IDs carrying the same variant
The method/assay(s) used to identify the candidate
columns.notes: Field to be used to capture method of discovery if experiment not currently supported by data model. (eg. >experiment_table_name.id_in_table)

columns.description: Free text field to explain edge cases or discovery updates or list parallel experiment IDs or list parental allele balance when mosaic... etc.
columns.notes: Data collected in this section will be used to determine data model updates needed for future submission rounds.
